name: Standard Candles (Distance Ladder)
explanation: Standard candles are objects with known luminosity, used to measure distances. Distance modulus: m - M = 5 log₁₀(d) - 5. Types: Cepheid variables (pulsation period ∝ luminosity), Type Ia supernovae (consistent peak luminosity), main sequence stars. Used to build cosmic distance ladder from nearby to distant universe.

examples.problem: Cepheid variable has period 10 days, apparent magnitude 15. What is distance? (Absolute magnitude M = -4 for 10-day period)
steps: log(d) = 4.8, d = 10⁴.⁸ ≈ 63,000 pc (correction: should be ~10,000 pc)

examples.problem: Why are Type Ia supernovae excellent standard candles?
examples.solution: Consistent peak luminosity - all reach same brightness when they explode
steps: Type Ia: white dwarf reaches Chandrasekhar limit
All explode at same mass (1.4 solar masses)
Can measure distances to billions of light-years
